FILE: cm371640v11.0.txt
DYAD: ARMENIA - TURKEY/OTTOMAN EMPIRE
RIVALRY: RIV1029
DISPUTE(S): MID3564 MID4221 

PS-NOTES:

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20190314
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20190318

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID3564 

TERRMID: MID3564 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3564 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID3564 from Gibler 2018, this is the Nagorno-Karabakh War, a territorial war fought between Armenia and Azerbaijan. In 1993, Turkey and Iran both protested that the war was endangering their border security, pulling them into this MID. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was connected to a territorial dispute outside this dyad. 

MARITMID: MID3564 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3564 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3564 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3564 the Nagorno-Karabakh War also involved militarized rebel groups organized along ethnic lines. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to civil war activity in Armenia, within this dyad. 

CIVWARLINK: MID3564 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID3564 the Nagorno-Karabakh War also involved militarized rebel groups organized along ethnic lines. Coded civil war link because this was connected to civil war activity in Azerbaijan, outside this dyad. (The disputed area contained ethnic groups and rebels from both Armenia and Azerbaijan.) 

COUPMID: MID3564 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3564 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3564 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4221 

TERRMID: MID4221 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4221 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4221 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4221 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4221 from cm narrative, A Russian guard was killed by Turkish border guards apparently after being lured toward the Turkish troops. Three months later, Turkish troops entered Armenian territory, finding Russian guards patrolling the Armenian border, who demanded the Turkish troops stop. Russian forces subsequently went on alert. Coded not third party link to territory because this was not connected to the Nagorno-Karabakh dispute. 

MARITMID: MID4221 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4221 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4221 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4221 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4221 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4221 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4221 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4221 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4221 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4221 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4221 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4221 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4434 

TERRMID: MID4434 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4434 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4434 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4434 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4434 from cm narrative, Armenian soldiers fired shots across the Turkish-Armenian border, resulting in a Turkish diplomatic protest. Coded not third party link to territory because although tensions between the two states have remained high, in part due to Turkish support of Azerbaijan in the Nagorno-Karabakh dispute, that territorial dispute between Armenia and Azerbaijan was not directly connected to this MID. 

MARITMID: MID4434 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4434 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4434 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4434 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4434 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4434 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4434 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4434 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4434 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4434 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4434 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4434 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4 2002-2010:

MID4434
rivalry=371640 nationa=ARMENIA nationb=TURKEY/OTTOMAN EMPIRE MID4434 20061011-20061011 
 revtype1a=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=USE OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE
fatalpb=0 lhostb=NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

Armenian soldiers fire shots across the Turkish-Armenian border, resulting in a Turkish diplomatic protest. Tensions between the two states have remained high, in part due to Turkish support with Azerbaijan in the Nagorno-Karabakh dispute. First day of dispute was on 10/11/2006 and last day of dispute was on 10/11/2006.

MID3 1993-2001:

MID4221
rivalry=371640 nationa=TURKEY/OTTOMAN EMPIRE nationb=ARMENIA MID4221 20000911-20000911 
 revtype1a=POLICY revtype2a=TERRITORY fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=USE OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=0
lhostb=NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

A Russian guard was killed by Turkish border guards apparently after being lured toward the Turkish troops. Three months later, Turkish troops entered Armenian territory, finding Russian guards patrolling the Armenian border, who demanded the Turkish troops stop. Russian forces subsequently went on alert. First and last day of dispute was on 9/11/2000.

RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:

SOURCES-CM:

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield.
